title.rendered: Celebration of Double ton costs sudden injury to David Warner

content.rendered:
Veteran Australian batsman, David Warner scored a double ton in 2nd test versus South Africa on Tuesday. Warner, however, grew to become it right into a double barrel with simply 254 balls. But quickly after achieving the milestone, the Australian batsman turned into compelled to retire injured. As he got injured while emphatically celebrating the milestone. (Read Also: New PCB Chief Najam Sethi stand on the latest BCCI Vs PCB Clash)

Warner had suffered from cramps even earlier than achieving the two hundred-run milestones. But the manner he celebrated the landmark appears to have worsened his condition. The establishing slugger turned additionally visible clutching his thighs as he sought clinical attention. At a few factors, the southpaw should not retain and needed to surrender injured.

He needed to be dealt with numerous instances of cramps and in the end retired to two hundred with pain. He left the field with some help.

After the end of the day for today, Warner can pop out batting once more on day 3 of the second Test. The Cricket Australia group hopes the great batsman will make a complete restoration in a single day. And he may be geared up to bat the following day if the scenario requires it.

In the direction of triple figures, the 36-year-vintage finished 8,000 check runs. He became the 8th Australian to do so. The inning developed under full pressure to must score for him.

He notched his first Test century considering that January 2020 showed doubters incorrect on the day of the second test. And that was with opposing bowlers tired withinside the searing heat. He battled the factors and switched it to two hundred.

His 3rd test doubles century scored 254 balls with sixteen fours and sixes in a patience test withinside the heat.
